page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: BOTTLING PLANT (BONFIELD'S cont.) The bottling plant will start at 11.30am.You put an empty bottle in one end and it comes out full with the top on it.It is 145'fahrenheit which kills the bacteria and that is called pasteurising the milk. They deliver 1000 pints a day and they divide them between Whitwell, Preston and Kings Walden area. These are some of the milks that are brought in from Luton. _ Channel Islands cream separated. _ Homogenised-Cream mixed-in. _ They have skimmed milk made by the Bonfields. _ Sometimes the milk has a flavour of watercress.
